definition: to disappear without trace/to vanish all of a sudden/to spread fast/to spread like wildfire
(negative prefix)/not/no
wing/area surrounding the bullseye of a target/to assist/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/old variant of 翌
surname Yi/alternative name for 絳|绛[Jiang4] capital of the Jin State during the Spring and Autumn Period (770-475 BC)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to fly

sentences.english: When he wakes up he finds that he is locked the handcuffs by the guard, Owen and electric edition disappear suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 贵仁醒来被警卫锁上手铐，欧文及电版不翼而飞。

sentences.english: Drinking wine, cowboy out of a bar, he found his horse had been missing.
sentences.chinese: 喝完酒，牛仔走出酒吧，发现他的马已不翼而飞。

sentences.english: Why M village often night chicken will take wings to itself?
sentences.chinese: 为什么M村经常夜里家鸡会不翼而飞？

sentences.english: When Bob returned to the room, he was surprised to find that his books had vanished into thin air.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃回到房间时，发现他的书籍不翼而飞，大吃一惊。

sentences.english: The front door was missing. A hole gaped in the roof.
sentences.chinese: 前门不翼而飞，屋顶豁开了一个洞。

definition: to have disappeared/to be missing/nowhere to be found
whereabouts unknown/gone missing
to lose by theft/to have one's property stolen
to steal everything
to remove/to take away
to lose/lost
as empty as anything (idiom); completely bereft/to have nothing/vacuous/hollow/empty (argument, head etc)
missing/lost
to return something to its rightful owner
thief
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
to have sth stolen/to lose to theft/robbed
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
the people are gone and the place is empty (idiom)/the sight of a deserted place brings old friends to mind/the place is deserted/the birds have flown
booty/stolen property
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
